title: How to learn to understand technology (more so computer) related words - Quora

response.answer_text: Here are a few ‘basic’ keywords.. Bytes, Kilobytes, Megabytes, Gigabytes and Terabytes:Everything listed here is a form of storage in order from smallest to biggest. Most Computers made after 2014 have atleast 1tb which is about 500 hours of movies. Mobile phones have gigabytes, usually in 4gb (10 hours of non HD content)Resolution:Your resolution can be a varity of things from 1366 x 766 to 3840 x 2160 but the most common would be 1080 x 1920. Your resolution is measured by the amount of pixels going either way on your screen (Eg: The resolution 720 x 1280 has 921,600 pixels in the screen.Pixels:Pixels are individual lights that light up your screen in over 16.8 million different colours. As explained above, you can find out how many pixels are in your screen by multiplying the two numbers in it.Operating System:Parts such as your CPU (Central Processing Unit) and Motherboard are the hardware side of your computer but the operating system is the software side. The most well known names for operating systems are Android, Windows, iOS and Mac OS X. Operating systems are the reason you can use Quora, play games, do keystrokes on your keyboard and much more.

You are one of a kind. Don’t ruin it. You can exploit your mobile to learn more about it. I tried to root my android phone and messed it up and then I installed free frame-ware (more like functional settings) from net and now I know how to do these things. I have wrecked my pc many times. Then I saw people how they fixed it and now I know what I am doing. You couldn’t understand fire was hot until you burnt yourself. Burn your techs :v
